Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2010 11:52AM jojo0624 wrote: Hi there, Thank you for responding. Yes you are right I have microcalcification and the mammo BIRAD rate came back as a four. I guess anytime there is some type of abnormality its classified as a four. Please correct me if I am wrong. I am new to this and right now   I have read so much information that a lot of it does not even make sense anymore (i'm sure i'm just overwhelmed). Thanks for forwarding the radiology assistant website.  I really appreciate it.
Posts.Title: Bilateral Breast Biopsies jojo0624 tboskin

Posts.Content: jojo0624 wrote: hi On Dec. 31 I had bilateral breast biopsies done because I have calcification in both breasts.  At first I was not really worried but now that the procedure is done and the bandages have come off I am pretty scarred.  I have not been able to find anything on this board regarding having calcification on both breasts therefore I am not sure if this is a common  or if my chances for having breast cancer are increased because both breasts are affected. I will see the surgeon this friday for my test results but, my anxiety level is increasing with each passing day. Any information that  you can provide is greatly appreciated.I am so grateful to have found this board.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bilateral Breast Biopsies jojo0624 tboskin
